physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Good left ventricular (LV) function and a thickened, 28-mm, predominantly anterior LV wall without intraventricular flow turbulence. Pronounced delayed hyperenhancement observed after gadolinium exposition within hypertrophied muscle areas.
Histology revealed myocardial disarray of muscular fibers and pronounced fibrosis.
During left heart catheterization, no intraventricular pressure gradient was measured.
MRI showed good ventricular function in the father, with even more pronounced delayed hyperenhancement in his hypertrophied LV but more septal affected areas.
